pageContext.description: Well worn: one angle of cutting edge broken away; raised bad encircling axe above loop worn down. Junction line of 2 halves of mould clearly indicated. Partly scraped down to bronze below patina on one face. Diameter of socket 33 x 31mm
pageContext.surface: Badly pitted on lower half; polished smoothly over remainder of surface.
pageContext.publications: C. Carter, North-Western Naturalist, June 1930, p. 91, Pl. 6, I.
pageContext.collection: Liverpool Museum, No. 13.7.06.1,Purchased from D. Bryers, 1906
pageContext.site: England,Lancashire,Liverpool (4 m. E of),Knotty Ash,Found in cutting a drain, road excavations at a dept of 3 ft. 6 in.,1906
pageContext.toSearch: Knotty Ash, Liverpool, Liverpool, Merseyside L14, UK
